organization.$: Belarusian State University of Informatics and Radioelectronics

head.citation-title: Two-dimensional non-separable quaternionic paraunitary filter banks
head.abstracts: © 2018 Division of Signal Processing and Electronic Systems, Poznan University of Technology (DSPES PUT). This paper presents a novel technique of factorization for 2-D non-separable quaternionic paraunitary filter banks (2-D NSQ-PUFB). Two-dimensional factorization structures called '16in-16out' and '64in-64out' respectively for 4-channel and 8-channel Q-PUFB based on the proposed technique are shown. The given structures can be mapped to parallel-pipeline processor architecture with a minimum latency time 2 (N+1) quaternion multiplication operations, where N is transform order of the Q-PUFB. The latency of parallel-pipeline processing does not depend on the size of the original image in contrast to the conventional 2-D transform. The coding gains CG MD of 2-D non-separable Q-PUFBs for the isotropic auto-correlation function model with the correlation factor ρ=0.95 are the following: CG MD =13.4 dB for '16in-16out' structure and CG MD =15.6 dB for '64in-64out' structure.
